climbs.name: Hand to Hand Combat
climbs.fa: KC Baum, Tom Archibeque and Jeff Hollenbaugh, 6/29/89

content.description: Climb a broken section of rock for 15 feet up into finger/hand crack.  Climb fingers and stem up to a small ledge and gain a nice hand crack.  Follow the hand crack up through some offwidth pods to a right-arching traverse to a flare and then the anchors.
content.protection: Fingers and many hand-sized pieces, 1-2 #4 Camalots.  Rap 130 feet from a 2 bolt anchor.
content.location: This is in the center of the buttress on the left side of a prominent prow.

content.description:
Begin at twin hand cracks with a chockstone ~15 up.  Pass the chockstone to a good ledge and climb the overhanging hand crack above (crux).  Continue up the crack system via mostly hands and a little offwidth before the chains.

Optional pitches 2 and 3 ascend dirty 5.6/7 crack and chimney to the rim.
content.protection: Standard rack plus many hand sized pieces, 1 #4 Camalot.
content.location: This is at the west end of the buttress.  A basketball-sized chockstone is visible ~15 feet up from the highway.  See the photo on the main page.

climbs.name: Crimson Behelit
climbs.fa: Alex Garhart and Daniel Garman, October 22, 2009

content.description: This route starts in a large right-facing corner with thin hands.  Climb thin hands to hands into a chimney (~60 ft).  At the beginning of the chimney traverse left 10 ft on a good ledge and gaze up into the gaping offwidth that awaits you.  Wedge yourself into the steeply overhung offwidth (crux) for some strenuous stacking.  Fight your way up to killer twin hand jams.  Follow twin cracks to the anchors.
content.protection: BD doubles of #1-#3, singles of new #4, old #4 and old #5 or new #6.  Long sling for traverse.  Two bolt anchor, rap the route.  With a 70 meter rope you can rap down the class 3/4 rock below the route to the ground and avoid the down scramble.
content.location:
50 yards left of

Hand to Hand Combat

in a large, right-facing corner in the middle of the buttress.  Scramble up ~25 ft of class 3/4 to reach the corner.  See photo on main page.
